resources.string: My interest in 3D modeling came about when I started learning the Unity Game Engine for fun. I decided to forgo 2D art that I\'ve grown accustomed to for higher quality, hand made 3D models.\n

I was used to using small game libraries that didn\'t support 3D models, but decided the opportunity to learns something new shouldn\'t be passed up. The multiple aspects of 3D modeling have proved to be a massive new area for me to explore.\n

I began learning 3D modeling and have since dedicated a lot of my spare time to it, finding it to be an excellent source of expression. There are more nuances and subtleties that allow for more accurate depictions of the mind\'s eye.\n
Throughout this App, I will be giving some information on 3D modeling and the things I\'ve learned since starting up.
First, a basic sculpt is made. This can be very technical or akin to working with clay depending on the program and method used. After this, we have several steps before the model is ready.
This process lowers the resolution of the model by decreasing the overall polygon count.
This is the process of unwrapping a model so that a 2D skin can be placed on it; much like a dissected cube.
Creating "bones" within a model that allow it to be moved how we would expect.
After the rig is made, it is bound to the 3D model in this process.
After all of this, you can begin animating a 3D model and capturing animations for different purposes.
3D Modeling has many different professional applications, each with their own subsects.
My current project is a character model. It is currently in the retopology phase. We can see the base sculpt in orange underneath the new topology.
